intro: Erysimum hayekii, commonly known as the Sierra Madre wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Sierra Madre Occidental in Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from yellow to orange. Erysimum hayekii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
